page.title: 10RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES
page.content: Used by the army for manoeuvres during the Second World War, the area is now being re-examined for long-buried unexploded shells, bombs and mines, prior to being offered for sale still as agricultural land, by the North West Water Authority at some future date. Meantime, it is used for a variety of recreational pursuits, as it is part of the West Pennine Moors Recreational Area, created in 1978. There are many public footpaths, used by ramblers and hikers, particularly at weekends. Duke of Edinburgh award expeditions take place about six times a year, usually at night, and in all weather conditions. It is also ideal for all orienteering activities. Naturalists and bird watchers can find much to interest and occupy them.
